item.title: Get Client IP Using jQuery
item.description: 1. One way This one gives you longitude/latitude and timezone. Try it! <td> <div> <div> <code>$(document).ready( </code><code>function</code><code>() { $.getJSON( </code><code>"&lt;a href="http://smart-ip.net/geoip-json?callback=?">http://smart-ip.net/geoip-json?callback=?&lt;/a>"</code><code>, </code><code>function</code><code>(data){ alert( data.host); } );});</code> </div> </div> </td> </tr> </table> Returns: <div> 2 </div> <div> 3 </div> <div> 4 </div> <div> 5 </div> <div> 6 </div> <div> 7 </div> <div> 8 </div> <div> 9 </div> <div> 10 </div> <div> 11 </div> <div> 12 </div> <div> 13 </div> <div> 14 </div> </td> <td> <div> <div> <code>?
